name: Famous People Called George Quiz | Name Game | 25 Questions

questions.text: The first president of the USA was George _____________ .
The former Beatle who became a film producer with Handmade Films was George _______ .
This American had a successful career on radio, television and in films. At the age of seventy-nine he won an Oscar for 'The Sunshine Boys' (1975): George _______ .
The U.S. President who was Vice-President to Ronald Reagan, George ...?
His books include 'Animal Farm' (1945) and 'Nineteen Eighty-Four' (1949), George ... ?
The English singer who teamed up with friend Andrew Ridgeley to form 'The Executives' before changing the name to 'Wham', George ... ?
The highly talented Northern Irish footballer who played for Manchester United, George ... ?
The French romantic novelist who is remembered for her long list of lovers including Chopin with whom she lived for eight years. George ... ?
questions.explanation:
Sand & George Sand.

	Amandine Aurore Lucie Dudevant adopted her masculine pseudonym for the novel 'Indiana' (1832).

questions.text: The American singer whose British hits include 'Give Me The Night' and 'In Your Eyes', George ... ?
The British record producer of the Beatles, George ... ?
The English painter of animals especially horses, such as "Whistlejacket", George ... ?
The French composer of the opera 'Carmen', Georges ... ?
The American actor who won an Oscar for his performance playing the lead in 'Patton' (1970) which he refused to accept. George Campbell ... ?
The American composer and lyricist whose songs include 'The Yankee Doodle Boy' and 'Give My Regards To Broadway', George Michael ... ?
The American opinion poll organizer, George Horace ... ?
The English founder of the religious group, the 'Society of Friends' or the 'Quakers' as they are usually called, George ... ?
questions.explanation:
Fox.

	Some of you may think it was William Penn, but in fact he was the first Quaker to arrive in America.

questions.text: The English social reformer and founder of the YMCA in 1844, Sir George ... ?
The English engineer who built the steam locomotive 'The Rocket', George ... ?
Name the Quaker and chocolate manufacturer who expanded his father's business and established a model village for his workers at Bourneville, George ... ?
Which British naturalist and conservationist, best known for his work with his wife Joy, and the lioness Elsa, was murdered by bandits in a remote game park in Kenya, George ... ?
Name the English entertainer and ukulele player whose risque songs sung in his broad Lancashire accent included 'Cleaning Windows' and 'Mr. Wu', George ... ?
This American inventor founded the Kodak photographic company, George ... ?
Who was the American film director of 'The Philadelphia Story' (1940) and 'My Fair Lady' (1964) which won him an oscar, George ... ?
Name the French physicist who developed 'Neon Lighting' which was displayed for the first time at the Paris Motor Show in 1910, George ... ?
Name the Belgian novelist and creator of 'Maigret', Georges ... ?
